author: 56cdab144f85abfb36c6c089
summary: Plays back audio data stored in an AudioBuffer

ports.name: Audio Buffer
ports.text: The audio buffer (typically from an audio file) which contains the audio data. In most cases you need to create a `AudioBuffer` op to load your audio sample and connect it to this port.

ports.name: Start / Stop
ports.text: When set the playback is started

ports.name: Start Time
ports.text: The time in seconds when the sound should begin to play (once `Start / Stop` has been set to `true`). A time of `0` means *play now*, `3` means at 3 seconds of the web audio time.

ports.name: Stop Time
ports.text: The time in seconds when the sound should stop to play (once `Start / Stop` has been set to `false`). A time of `0` means *stop now*.

ports.name: Autoplay
ports.text: When set to `true` the sound will start to play as soon as the `AudioBuffer` is loaded.

ports.name: Loop
ports.text: Weather or not the playback should start from the beginning once the end has been reached. Please note that some browsers have problems doing a perfect loop with certain file types. If you e.g. use an MP3-file as `AudioBuffer` Google Chrome might produce a slight gap between the loops. Ogg-files sometimes work better.

ports.name: Detune
ports.text: How much the sound should be detuned in [cents](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cent_(music)). `-100` means one semitone lower, `100` one semitone higher, `12000` is one octave higher (`12 * 100`).

ports.name: Playback Rate
ports.text: How fast / slow the audio should be played back, `1` is normal speed, `2` double speed, `0.5` half speed.
